III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Policy and procedures

Section • (2) The policies and procedures must cover at least all the
Description following areas:
• (e) Supervision provided by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff not available to let Youth A into the residence.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator 1 by telephone on 3/15/2024.
Chief Administrator 1 referred to Program Manager 1 for additional
information related to the incident.
I interviewed Program Manager 1 by telephone on 3/15/2024.
Program Manager 1 stated he was familiar with the situation as he
was a staff who was contacted to help Youth A gain access into
the house. Program Manager 1 stated there was no staff
immediately present to let Youth A into the house as Youth A was
the only youth at the time and they did not know when Youth A
was planning to return to the house. Program Manager 1 stated a
key to the house is kept in a lockbox outside and youth are given
the code to get the key out when/if this type of situation would
occur. Program Manager 1 reported staff did eventually arrive to
let Youth A into the house. Program Manager 1 confirmed Youth A
was able to contact staff and gain access to the house.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 by telephone on 3/15/2024.
Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth A had contacted Foster Care
Worker 1 at the time of the incident. Foster Care Worker 1 stated
Youth A used facetime on Youth A's phone to show Foster Care
Worker 1 the key and the lock box referenced by Program
Manager 1. Foster Care Worker 1 stated she thought the key that
was in the box looked like a cabinet key and not a house key.
Foster Care Worker 1 confirmed Staff 1 did arrive to let Youth A
into the house. Foster Care Worker 1 reported Youth A was not at
the house the night before and Youth A is not at the house very
often.
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 5/3/2024. Youth A
described the incident similar to the reports by Program Manager
1 and Foster Care Worker 1. Youth A confirmed staff did
eventually arrive to let Youth A into the house. Youth A stated that
type of situation does not currently happen as there are more
youth in the house to let each other in if staff is not present.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the contract document for this program. The contract
only requires 16 hours of staff coverage on a daily basis. Staff
coverage during the week is not contractually required prior to
3:00 PM. The time of this incident was prior to the 3:00 PM time
requirement.
2

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as determined by the
interviews completed with Youth A and other related participants
in the incident. Youth A was able to contact agency staff and gain
access to the home.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
